dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think a fintech company in Kazakhstan might be risky, but actually, Moodys just upgraded Kaspi Bank to investment grade Baa3.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think a fintech company in Kazakhstan might be risky, but actually, Moodys just upgraded Kaspi Bank to investment grade Baa3.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a huge deal, moving from Ba1 to Baa3. They specifically mentioned the resilience of Kaspi's business model, like their Fintech, Payments, and Marketplace platforms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a huge deal, moving from Ba1 to Baa3. They specifically mentioned the resilience of Kaspi's business model, like their Fintech, Payments, and Marketplace platforms.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform. Moodys cited sound profitability, liquidity and the resilience of Kaspi.kzs proven business model including Fintech, Payments and Marketplace Platforms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just the company—Moodys also upgraded Kazakhstan's government rating to Baa1, which uh, really supports the whole operating environment there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just the company-Moodys also upgraded Kazakhstan's government rating to Baa1, which uh, really supports the whole operating environment there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan led Moodys on 9 September 2024 to upgrade its Kazakhstan government rating to Baa1 from Baa2, with a stable outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the CEO, Ruslan Abdrakhmanov, pointed out that they're trusted by over 14 million people and 700 thousand merchants, mostly small businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the C E O, Ruslan Abdrakhmanov, pointed out that they're trusted by over fourteen million people and seven hundred thousand merchants, mostly small businesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a massive user base. It's like their Super App strategy is really paying off, connecting consumers and merchants seamlessly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a massive user base. It's like their Super App strategy is really paying off, connecting consumers and merchants seamlessly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and Harvard Business School even teaches case studies on them. I mean, that's some serious recognition for a company from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and Harvard Business School even teaches case studies on them. I mean, that's some serious recognition for a company from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Harvard Business School has written two case studies on Kaspi.kz which it continues to teach to its MBA students.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's impressive how they've built this capex-lite model that drives growth without huge capital expenditures. Their profitability and liquidity are apparently sound.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's impressive how they've built this capex-lite model that drives growth without huge capital expenditures. Their profitability and liquidity are apparently sound.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz has sound fundamentals, such as profitability, capitalisation and liquidity. The combination of a large, highly engaged consumer and merchant base, best-in-class, highly relevant digital products and a capex lite approach, results in strong top-line growth, a profitable business model and enables us to continue innovating, delighting our users and fulfilling our mission.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they've been on Nasdaq since January, so this upgrade probably boosts investor confidence even more.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've been on Nasdaq since January, so this upgrade probably boosts investor confidence even more.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz has been listed on Nasdaq since January 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. You know, it's rare to see a fintech with such a diverse set of services all in one ecosystem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. You know, it's rare to see a fintech with such a diverse set of services all in one ecosystem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the fact that Moodys has been tracking them for years shows this isn't just a flash in the pan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the fact that Moodys has been tracking them for years shows this isn't just a flash in the pan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It feels like Kaspi.kz is at the heart of Kazakhstan's digital transformation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It feels like the website is at the heart of Kazakhstan's digital transformation.

artist_script:
HostA: People think a fintech company in Kazakhstan might be risky, but actually, Moodys just upgraded Kaspi Bank to investment grade Baa3.
HostB: Yeah, that's a huge deal, moving from Ba1 to Baa3. They specifically mentioned the resilience of Kaspi's business model, like their Fintech, Payments, and Marketplace platforms.
HostA: And it's not just the company—Moodys also upgraded Kazakhstan's government rating to Baa1, which uh, really supports the whole operating environment there.
HostB: Right, and the CEO, Ruslan Abdrakhmanov, pointed out that they're trusted by over 14 million people and 700 thousand merchants, mostly small businesses.
HostA: That's a massive user base. It's like their Super App strategy is really paying off, connecting consumers and merchants seamlessly.
HostB: Exactly, and Harvard Business School even teaches case studies on them. I mean, that's some serious recognition for a company from Kazakhstan.
HostA: It's impressive how they've built this capex-lite model that drives growth without huge capital expenditures. Their profitability and liquidity are apparently sound.
HostB: And they've been on Nasdaq since January, so this upgrade probably boosts investor confidence even more.
HostA: For sure. You know, it's rare to see a fintech with such a diverse set of services all in one ecosystem.
HostB: Yeah, and the fact that Moodys has been tracking them for years shows this isn't just a flash in the pan.
HostA: Absolutely. It feels like Kaspi.kz is at the heart of Kazakhstan's digital transformation.
